I think the best way is calling a config.bat file before runing ant, you sh=
ould call set method to set the user.dir variable in config.bat.

=E4=B8=BB=E9=A2=98: [junit] *.dll library in wrong "user.dir"


Hi All

W=
hen running junit via ant I set the user dir using
            <sysproperty=
 key=3D=3D"user.dir" value=3D=3D"${testrun}"/>
in the junit task (see full =
task below).

My java code loads a *.dll library which also needs to know t=
he same user
dir. However, running through ant's junit task it seems as if =
the *.dll is
running in a different user dir (not having the code for the *=
.dll I haven't
been able to detect which). When I run my java code directly=
 from the promt
there's no problem at all (the *.dll library then also know=
s the correct
user directory).

How could I in my tests get the *.dll libra=
ry to run in the same correct
"user.dir"?
Any hits?

Thanks in advance.

Mo=
rten

PS: my junit task looks like this:
    <target name=3D=3D"test" depen=
ds=3D=3D"testdirectories"
        description=3D=3D"Test the distribution w=
ith JUnit" >

        <!-- Run tests with JUnit -->
        <junit fork=3D=
=3D"on" dir=3D=3D"${build}" showoutput=3D=3D"true">
            <classpath =
refid=3D=3D"testlibs" />
            <classpath path=3D=3D"${build.testclas=
ses}" />
            <classpath path=3D=3D"${project.jar}" />
            <=
formatter type=3D=3D"xml" />
            <jvmarg line=3D=3D"-Xmx256m -Xss81=
92k" />
            <test name=3D=3D"${testtorun}" />
            <sysprope=
rty key=3D=3D"user.dir" value=3D=3D"${testrun}"/>
        </junit>
    </ta=
rget>
